description.headline1: UK GDP grew by 0.3% in Quarter 3 2019
description.headline2: The services sector was the main driver to GDP growth in the three months to September 2019
description.headline3: Rolling three-month growth returned to rates seen before the notable strength in the three months to March 2019
description.meta_description: Gross domestic product (GDP) measures the value of goods and services produced in the UK. It estimates the size of and growth in the economy.
description.summary: Gross domestic product (GDP) measures the value of goods and services produced in the UK. It estimates the size of and growth in the economy.
description.title: GDP monthly estimate, UK

description.headline1: UK GDP grew by 0.3% in the three months to August 2019
description.headline2: Services was the main driver to rolling three-month GDP growth in August 2019
description.headline3: Rolling three-month growth was 0.3% in the three months to August 2019

description.headline1: UK gross domestic product (GDP) contracted by 0.2% in Quarter 2 (Apr to June) 2019
description.headline2: Output in production and construction both fell, causing GDP to contract
description.headline3: Rolling three-month growth contracted for the first time since Quarter 4 (Oct to Dec) 2012
description.meta_description: Gross domestic product (GDP) measures the value of goods and services produced in the UK. It estimates the size of and growth in the economy.

description.headline1: UK gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 0.3% in the three months to April 2019
description.headline2: All main sectors contributed positively to GDP growth in the three months to April 2019
description.headline3: Rolling three-month growth was 0.3% in the three months to April 2019

description.headline1: UK gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 0.6% in Quarter 3 2018
description.headline2: Quarterly GDP growth was driven mainly by the services sector, although the construction sector also had a notable positive contribution
description.headline3: Three-month growth remained strong after a weaker start to the year

description.headline1: UK gross domestic product (GDP) grew by 0.6% in the three months to July.
description.headline2: GDP growth was driven by services and construction, with a small drag on growth from production.

description.headline1: UK GDP grew by 1.2% in December 2020.
description.headline2: The output measure of GDP grew by 1.0% in Quarter 4 2020.
description.headline3: Annual GDP fell by 9.9% in 2020, the largest yearly fall on record.

description.headline1: UK GDP grew by 6.6% in July 2020.
description.headline2: GDP fell by 7.6% in the three months to July 2020, with declines across all main sectors of the economy.
description.headline3: In July, monthly GDP was 11.7% lower than the pre-pandemic levels seen in February 2020.
